definition[0]: if a horse trots, it moves fairly quickly with each front leg moving at the same time as the opposite back leg
definition[1]: if a person or animal trots, they run fairly slowly, taking short regular steps
example[0]: She came trotting down the steps from the library.
definition[2]: to walk or go somewhere, especially fairly quickly
example[1]: He trotted off and came back a couple of minutes later, holding a parcel.
definition[3]: the movement of a horse at trotting speed
example[2]: Our horses slowed to a trot.
definition[4]: a ride on a horse at trotting speed
definition[5]: a fairly slow way of running in which you take short regular steps
example[3]: She broke into a trot  (=started running slowly) and hurried on ahead of us.
definition[6]: a book of notes or answers used by students, especially to cheat in tests
definition[7]: an insulting word for a Trotskyite
